capture-the-vip.author: Fantasy Flight Games
capture-the-vip.name: Capture the VIP
capture-the-vip.setup: After placing obstacles, the second player places 1 objective token at distance 1 of any obstacle and beyond distance 5 of all edges of the setup area.
capture-the-vip.special_rule:
When a ship at distance 1 of the objective token reveals a command dial, the ship's owner may remove that objective token from the play area and place it on that ship's card.
When a ship with the objective token on its ship card is destroyed, the opposing player places the objective token in the play area touching the destroyed ship's base.
capture-the-vip.end_of_game: If a player's ship has the objective token, that player gains 1 victory token.

fighter-ambush.author: Fantasy Flight Games
fighter-ambush.name: Fighter Ambush
fighter-ambush.setup:
Before deploying fleets, the second player sets aside all of his squadrons.
After deploying fleets, the second player deploys all of his squadrons. Each of his squadrons can be placed as normal or at distance 1 of an obstacle, but all his squadrons must be beyond distance 5 of the first player's edge.
fighter-ambush.special_rule: After a squadron performs an attack against a ship, if the defender was dealt at least 1 damage card, the squadron's owner gains 1 victory token.

jamming-barrier.author: Fantasy Flight Games
jamming-barrier.name: Jamming Barrier
jamming-barrier.setup:
Place obstacles as normal, excluding the station and replacing the 2 debris fields with the 2 dust fields.
After deploying fleets, the second player places 2 objective tokens in the setup area at distance 1-5 of each other.
jamming-barrier.special_rule: While attacking, if line of sight is traced across the line between the two objective tokens, the attacker must choose and remove half of the dice from the attack pool rounded down, before rolling.
jamming-barrier.errata: While attacking, if neither the attacker or defender are overlapping an objective token and line of sight is traced across an objective token or the line between the two objective tokens, the attacker must choose and remove half of the dice from the attack pool, rounded down, before rolling.

planetary-ion-cannon.author: Fantasy Flight Games
planetary-ion-cannon.name: Planetary Ion Cannon
planetary-ion-cannon.setup: After placing obstacles, the second player places 3 objective tokens in the play area beyond distance 5 of both players' edges.
planetary-ion-cannon.special_rule:
At the end of the Command Phase, the second player may choose 1 enemy ship at distance 1-3 of an objective token and remove that token from the play area to perform an attack against that ship. The attacker is treated as if it is a ship with a battery armament of 4 blue dice, but is not friendly to any ship or squadron. The attack is treated as being at medium range, cannot be obstructed, can target any of the defender's hull zones, and has the following critical effect:
Blue :crit:: The defender must choose and exhaust 1 of his defense tokens.
